p: OA (18:1) is a monounsaturated omega-9 fatty acid with 18 carbons and a double bound situated in the carbon number 9. Seed and soft parts are rich in oleic acid. The proportions of OA in both parts are 13–19% in seed oil and 12–33% in pulp oil [ 22]. An advantage of OA in regard to other monounsaturated fatty acids is its resistance to oxidation [ 23].
